definitions: exercising and enforcing complete political control over all aspects of citizens' lives
relating to a system of government that recognizes no limits to its authority
examples: The totalitarian regime controlled every aspect of daily life
North Korea remains one of the world's most totalitarian states
His totalitarian management style left no room for dissent
The party's totalitarian ambitions became increasingly apparent

definitions: feeling grateful, sympathetic, or emotionally moved by someone's actions or words
showing slight signs of mental instability or eccentricity in behavior
examples: She was deeply touched by their thoughtful gesture
The audience was touched by his heartfelt speech
The old hermit seemed a bit touched after years alone
Everyone thought he was touched but harmless

definitions: arousing feelings of sympathy, gratitude, or tenderness in others
making physical contact with or being adjacent to something
examples: The soldier's touching letter home brought tears to her eyes
It was a touching moment when they reunited
The two buildings are almost touching at their closest point
Place the wires touching to complete the circuit

definitions: strong enough to withstand adverse conditions or rough handling
requiring considerable effort, skill, or determination to deal with successfully
able to endure hardship or pain without showing weakness
strict and uncompromising in attitude or demands toward others
examples: These tough hiking boots will last for years
The meat was too tough to chew easily
Solving this equation is a tough mathematical challenge
She faced tough competition in the tournament
You need to be tough to survive in this business
Growing up poor made him mentally tough
The new coach is tough but fair with players
The judge took a tough stance on crime

definitions: reaching an impressive or intimidating height above surroundings
outstanding or intense in degree, quality, or emotional force
examples: The towering redwoods blocked out most of the sunlight
A towering skyscraper dominated the city skyline
She flew into a towering rage when she heard
His towering intellect impressed everyone he met

definitions: containing or being poisonous material especially when capable of causing death or serious debilitation
causing severe psychological or emotional harm through negative behavior patterns
examples: The factory leaked toxic chemicals into the river
These mushrooms contain toxic compounds dangerous to humans
Their toxic relationship was destroying both of their lives
The workplace had become toxic with constant conflicts

definitions: relating to the branch of science concerned with poisons and their effects
examples: The toxicological report revealed traces of cyanide
She specialized in toxicological analysis at the lab
Toxicological studies confirmed the drug was safe
The forensic team awaited toxicological test results

definitions: able to be found or followed through investigation or tracking methods
able to be attributed to a particular source, origin, or cause
examples: The email was traceable to a specific IP address
All products are traceable through our tracking system
Her fear of water was traceable to a childhood incident
The tradition is traceable to medieval times

definitions: relating to or affecting the trachea or windpipe in anatomy
examples: The patient required tracheal intubation during surgery
Tracheal infections can cause severe breathing problems
The doctor examined the tracheal passages with a scope
A tracheal tube was inserted to maintain airway

definitions: equipped with continuous tracks instead of wheels for movement
being followed, monitored, or recorded systematically over time
examples: The tracked vehicle easily crossed the muddy terrain
Tracked excavators work better on soft ground
All tracked packages arrived at their destinations safely
Her progress was carefully tracked throughout treatment

definitions: having no paths, trails, or established routes through an area
not running on tracks or rails as a transportation system
examples: They ventured into the trackless wilderness with only a compass
The trackless desert stretched endlessly before them
The city introduced trackless trolleys powered by overhead wires
A trackless train system uses rubber tires instead

definitions: easy to control, manage, or influence in behavior or attitude
able to be dealt with, solved, or cured successfully
examples: The once wild horse had become tractable after months of training
Children become more tractable when their needs are met
This is a tractable problem with known solutions
The disease proved more tractable than initially feared

definitions: relating to or providing the pulling or drawing force in mechanical systems
examples: The locomotive's tractive effort was insufficient for the heavy load
Engineers calculated the tractive force needed for the vehicle
The tractor's tractive power easily pulled the plow through soil
Improved tire design increased the car's tractive capability

definitions: legally registered and protected as a trademark identifying products or services
examples: The trademarked logo cannot be used without permission
Several trademarked phrases appear in their advertising
Their trademarked process revolutionized the industry
The company's trademarked name is recognized worldwide

definitions: following or belonging to the customs, beliefs, or ways of behaving that have continued in a group for a long time
produced, done, or used in accordance with long-established methods or styles
examples: They celebrated with a traditional wedding ceremony
Traditional values still guide many rural communities
She preferred traditional furniture to modern designs
The restaurant serves traditional Italian cuisine

definitions: adhering to or advocating for traditional beliefs, customs, and practices
examples: His traditionalist views clashed with progressive policies
The traditionalist faction opposed all reforms
She took a traditionalist approach to teaching literature
Traditionalist architects rejected modernist principles

definitions: causing or characterized by extreme distress, sorrow, or unfortunate consequences
relating to or characteristic of tragedy as a dramatic or literary form
examples: The tragic accident claimed three young lives
It would be tragic if they lost their home
Shakespeare wrote several tragic plays about doomed heroes
The actor excelled in tragic roles

definitions: having received professional education or instruction in a particular field
having been taught to perform specific tasks or behaviors through practice
examples: Only trained medical personnel should administer this treatment
She's a trained pianist with years of experience
The trained dogs could detect explosives accurately
His trained eye spotted the forgery immediately

definitions: guilty of or involving betrayal of allegiance, trust, or confidence
examples: His traitorous actions endangered the entire mission
The general's traitorous plot was discovered in time
She felt traitorous for revealing her friend's secret
Traitorous thoughts crossed his mind during the rebellion

definitions: free from disturbance, agitation, or commotion; peacefully quiet and calm
examples: The tranquil lake reflected the mountains perfectly
She maintained a tranquil demeanor despite the chaos
We spent a tranquil afternoon reading in the garden
The medication helped create a more tranquil state of mind

definitions: crossing or extending across the Atlantic Ocean, especially between Europe and America
examples: They took a transatlantic flight from London to New York
Transatlantic trade increased significantly last year
The transatlantic cable revolutionized international communication
She maintains strong transatlantic business connections

definitions: surpassing ordinary experience, thought, or belief; going beyond normal limits
relating to a spiritual realm beyond ordinary human experience or understanding
examples: Her transcendent beauty captivated everyone who saw her
The music achieved a transcendent quality rarely heard
He sought transcendent truth through years of meditation
The mystic claimed to have transcendent experiences

definitions: relating to or denoting experience beyond normal physical or material existence
relating to the philosophical movement emphasizing intuition and spirituality over empirical knowledge
examples: She described her near-death experience as transcendental
The philosopher explored transcendental aspects of consciousness
Thoreau's transcendental philosophy influenced American literature
The transcendental movement shaped 19th-century thought

definitions: extending or traveling across a continent from one side to another
examples: The transcontinental railroad connected the Atlantic and Pacific coasts
They completed a transcontinental journey by bicycle
The company operates transcontinental freight services daily
A transcontinental pipeline carries oil across the country

definitions: converted from spoken words into written or typed form
copied or transferred from one medium, format, or notation to another
examples: The transcribed interview revealed important new details
All testimony was carefully transcribed by court reporters
The ancient text was transcribed from hieroglyphs to modern script
Musicians transcribed the folk songs for orchestra

definitions: applied to or passing through the skin for systemic absorption
examples: The patient uses a transdermal patch for pain relief
Transdermal medication delivery avoids digestive issues
Some transdermal treatments provide steady drug levels
The transdermal system releases hormones continuously

definitions: capable of being moved or conveyed from one place, person, or situation to another
able to be applied or used in different contexts or situations
examples: The warranty is transferable to subsequent owners
These tickets are not transferable to other dates
Her transferable skills made her valuable in any industry
The lessons learned are transferable to other projects

definitions: changed completely in form, appearance, nature, or character
examples: The old warehouse was transformed into luxury apartments
She emerged transformed after her year abroad
The transformed landscape bore no resemblance to before
Technology has transformed how we communicate

definitions: denoting or relating to people whose gender identity differs from the sex assigned at birth
examples: The company updated policies to support transgender employees
Transgender rights have become an important social issue
She came out as transgender during her senior year
The clinic specializes in transgender healthcare

definitions: lasting only for a short time; temporary or impermanent
staying or working in a place for only a short time
examples: The medication may cause transient side effects
Her happiness proved transient when reality set in
The hotel mainly serves transient business travelers
The transient population makes census counts difficult

definitions: relating to or marking a period of change from one state or condition to another
examples: The country established a transitional government after the revolution
This is a transitional phase in the company's development
The fossil represents a transitional form between species
They lived in transitional housing while seeking permanent homes

definitions: not permanent; lasting only for a short time before changing or ending
examples: Fame is often transitory in the entertainment industry
The pain should be transitory and subside soon
Their transitory relationship lasted only a few months
Life's pleasures can seem transitory and fleeting

definitions: relating to the process of translating text from one language to another
relating to motion in which all parts move in the same direction
examples: The translational accuracy of the software has improved significantly
She studies translational challenges in literary works
The mechanism converts rotational to translational motion
Translational velocity was measured in the experiment

definitions: allowing light to pass through but diffusing it so objects cannot be seen clearly
examples: The translucent curtains provided privacy while letting in light
Her skin had a translucent quality in the moonlight
The translucent glass panels created a soft ambient glow
Jellyfish have translucent bodies that shimmer underwater

definitions: able to be transmitted or passed from one person, organism, or place to another
examples: This strain of flu is highly transmissible between humans
The disease is transmissible through contaminated water
Cultural values are transmissible across generations
Some genetic traits are transmissible to offspring

definitions: sent or conveyed from one person, place, or thing to another
examples: The message was transmitted via satellite to headquarters
Diseases can be transmitted through various means
The transmitted signal was weak but detectable
Knowledge was transmitted orally for generations

definitions: extending or operating across national boundaries involving multiple countries
examples: The transnational corporation operates in fifty countries
They're investigating transnational organized crime networks
Transnational migration has increased in recent decades
The treaty addresses transnational environmental issues

definitions: allowing light to pass through so that objects can be seen clearly
easy to perceive, understand, or detect; obvious and open
examples: The transparent glass revealed everything inside the display
Fish swam beneath the transparent water surface
The company promised transparent communication with stakeholders
His motives were transparent to everyone present

definitions: having or showing dislike, prejudice, or hostility toward transgender people
examples: The transphobic comments sparked widespread criticism online
She challenged transphobic attitudes in the workplace
Transphobic violence remains a serious concern worldwide
The policy was criticized as discriminatory and transphobic

definitions: able to be carried or moved from one place to another
examples: The equipment is easily transportable between job sites
These transportable buildings can be relocated as needed
The data is transportable across different computer systems
Small, transportable generators provide emergency power

definitions: moved to a different position or order by switching or exchanging
written or played in a different musical key from the original
examples: The transposed digits caused an error in calculation
In the transposed version, chapters three and four are switched
The transposed melody sounds higher but maintains the same intervals
She transposed the song to suit her vocal range

definitions: having undergone or desiring medical treatment to change physical sex characteristics
examples: Support groups help transsexual individuals navigate healthcare systems
The clinic provides specialized care for transsexual patients
She wrote about her experiences as a transsexual woman
Transsexual rights are protected under anti-discrimination laws

definitions: situated or extending across something; positioned crosswise rather than lengthwise
examples: The transverse beam provides structural support across the building
A transverse fracture runs perpendicular to the bone
The transverse colon extends across the abdomen
Engineers installed transverse reinforcements in the bridge

definitions: a person who derives emotional satisfaction from dressing in clothes of the opposite gender
examples: The transvestite performer entertained audiences with elaborate costumes
Historical records mention transvestite individuals in many cultures
The club welcomes transvestite patrons every weekend
Some transvestite individuals express gender fluidity through clothing

definitions: having the shape of a trapezoid with two parallel sides
examples: The trapezoidal window added architectural interest to the facade
Engineers designed a trapezoidal cross-section for the channel
The table had an unusual trapezoidal top surface
Trapezoidal threads are common in mechanical screws

definitions: unable to move or escape from a place or situation
caught or captured by means of a trap or deliberate action
examples: The miners were trapped underground for three days
She felt trapped in an unhappy marriage
The trapped animals were safely relocated
Water vapor becomes trapped between the glass layers

definitions: of very poor quality or in bad taste; cheap and inferior
examples: She secretly enjoyed reading trashy romance novels
The movie was entertaining despite being completely trashy
His trashy behavior embarrassed everyone at the party
They decorated with trashy plastic ornaments

definitions: causing severe and lasting emotional shock and pain
relating to or caused by physical injury or wound
examples: The accident was a traumatic experience for everyone involved
Children may need therapy after traumatic events
The patient suffered traumatic brain injury in the fall
Traumatic fractures require immediate medical attention

definitions: having visited many places through journeys
used frequently by people passing through
examples: The well-traveled diplomat spoke seven languages fluently
She was traveled enough to adapt anywhere
This heavily traveled road needs constant maintenance
The less traveled path through the forest was peaceful

definitions: having visited many places through journeys
used frequently by people passing through
examples: The well-travelled journalist had stories from every continent
As a travelled professional, she understood cultural differences
The most travelled route saves considerable time
This rarely travelled trail offers solitude
